courses.name: Introduction to Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: A broad introduction to the canon of Western drama, the principles of theatre history as well as key artistic movements and notions of arts criticism through a range of dramatic texts, artistic movements, and performance practices, with particular reference to the relationship between dramatic texts and their larger contexts. This course combines weekly two-hour lectures with one-hour tutorials.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Students must sign up for a tutorial. They will be informed of their tutorial room on Portal in the first week of class.

cmCourseInfo.description: Emphasis is initially placed on ensemble, non-verbal, and improvisational work. Students proceed to the application of their acquired skills to scripted material. Students may apply in their first or second year of University. The Application Form Deadline is March 10th for the first round of auditions; August 10th for the second round. See Audition Guidelines for information on how to apply.
cmCourseInfo.title: Performance I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: An audition in April or in August. Students can apply directly out of high school.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Selection is based on an audition. Priority is reserved for Drama Majors and Specialists. Apply online by March 10th for a first round April audition or by August 10th for the second round audition held in late August. Student can apply straight out of high school: https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

notes.name: Section Note
notes.content: Time Changed: May 24, 2017

cmCourseInfo.description: An introduction to major concepts and artistic practices in directing, emphasizing theoretical and historical issues with supplemental practical application. The course focuses on different styles, ideas, and goals of theatre directors in their relations to actors, audiences, and broad cultural and political contexts. The application deadline is March 10th for an interview in April
cmCourseInfo.title: Directing I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: An interview in April or in August. Students can apply directly out of high school.
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation:
DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1

Distribution Requirement: Humanities

Breadth Requirement: Creative and Cultural Representations (1)

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Selection is based on an application. Priority is given to Drama Majors and Specialists. Apply online by November 10th. https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: An intensive study of a range of historical and cross-cultural dramatic and performance texts and practices that contextualize theatre and performance more broadly within the social, political, and cultural parameters in which they take place. Theatre history is necessarily inextricable from world history and this course considers the many ways theatre and performance interact with the globalized world.
cmCourseInfo.title: Comparative Theatre Histories
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1

cmCourseInfo.description: A hands-on study of the craft of dramatic writing. The class examines the basic elements of playwriting such as plot, structure, theme, character, dialogue, setting, with an emphasis on story-making. Attention is given to the development of students own work through written assignments and in-class exercises. See Portfolio Guidelines for information on how to apply.
cmCourseInfo.title: Playwriting I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: A portfolio of writing samples due on March 10th or August 10th. Students can apply directly out of high school.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Admission is based on a portfolio submission in March or in August. Apply online: https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login Priority is reserved for Drama Majors and Specialists. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: An introduction to the shifting landscapes of European theatre theory, history and practice in the late 19th century and their repercussions throughout the 20th and 21st centuries. The course focuses on the developments of modern and postdramatic theatre. It also includes critical analysis of the annual Drama Mainstage production and current Canadian theatre.
cmCourseInfo.title: Concepts of Twentieth-Century Theatre
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1

cmCourseInfo.description: A practical introduction to aspects of theatre design, with a module on theatre production. Working extensively in the Helen Gardiner Phelan Playhouse, the students form the core of the production team for Drama productions. Application Deadline is March 10th; see department website for details.
cmCourseInfo.title: Production and Design I: Production
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: An interview in April or in August. Students can apply directly out of high school. See online application for details.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Apply online by March 10th or August 10th: https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login Selection is based on an interview. Priority is reserved for Drama Majors and Specialists. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: Building upon the work of DRM200Y1, students concentrate on scene study, styles of acting, and the development of ensemble work with an intensive focus on voice and movement practices. The Application Deadline is April 10th.
cmCourseInfo.title: Performance I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1; DRM200Y1; Minimum CGPA of 2.7 or permission of the Drama Centre. See online application for more details. The Application Deadline is April 10th.
cmCourseInfo.corequisitesText: DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1 or any course from Group A if DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1 is complete; 1 FCE from DRM301H1/DRM311H1/DRM375H1/DRM376H1/ DRM377H1/DRM378H1.
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: and the development of ensemble work with an intensive focus on voice and movement practices. The

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
For more information on how to enrol, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

notes.name: Section Note
notes.content: Time Changed: July 11, 2017

cmCourseInfo.description: A continuation of DRM202H1, concentrating on major concepts and artistic practices in directing. The course focuses on different styles, ideas, and goals of theatre directors in their relations to actors, audiences, and broad cultural and political contexts. A major component will be the practical application of basic directing techniques.
cmCourseInfo.title: Directing II
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: If taken in the Fall, the pre-requisites are: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1; DRM202H1; Minimum CGPA of 2.7 or permission of the Drama Centre. If taken in the Winter, the pre-requisites are: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1; DRM202H1
cmCourseInfo.corequisitesText: DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1 or any course from Group A.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Selection is based on an application. Priority is given to Drama Majors and Specialists. Apply online by November 10th. https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: A continuation of DRM228H1, concentrating on the in-depth knowledge and practice of playwriting with an emphasis on style and technique of writing for the stage. Students develop their own work through written assignments, in-class exercises, and the final public presentation. See Portfolio Guidelines for information on how to apply and the deadline to apply.
cmCourseInfo.title: Playwriting II
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1; DRM228H1; Minimum CGPA of 2.7 and permission of the Centre. See online application for details.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Admission is based on a portfolio submission in April. Priority is reserved for Drama Majors and Specialists. Apply online: https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: Study of dramaturgical theory and of interpretations of the dramaturge's function in the theatre. Using examples from Canada and beyond, students apply this knowledge to theatre practice.
cmCourseInfo.title: Dramaturgy
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1

cmCourseInfo.description: A practical introduction to aspects of theatre production, with a module on scenic design. Working extensively in the Helen Gardiner Phelan Playhouse, the students form the core of the production team for Drama productions. Application Deadline is April 10th; see department website for details.
cmCourseInfo.title: Production and Design II: Design
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1, Minimum CGPA of 2.7 or permission of the Drama Centre. See online application for details.
cmCourseInfo.corequisitesText: DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1 or any course from Group A

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Admission is based on an interview in April. Priority is reserved for Drama Majors and Specialists. Apply online: https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: An in-depth examination of selected performance disciplines, styles, and genres within their historical and critical context. Content may vary depending on instructor. Please consult the Undergraduate Drama office or check Studio Topics on our website for more details.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Topics in Studio Practice
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1; DRM200Y1; Minimum CGPA of 2.7 or permission of the Drama Centre. See online application for details.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
To enrol in DRM375H1, you must take DRM300Y1 as a pre or co-requisite. To enrol in DRM300Y1 or for more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

courses.name: Special Topics in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: An in-depth examination of selected issues in drama, theatre and performance studies. Content may vary depending on instructor and is counted towards Group A. Please consult the Undergraduate Drama office and check Special Topics on the website for more details.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Topics in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1 or any 4.0 FCE

cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM100Y1/DRM101Y1/UNI102Y1 or any 4.0 FCE

courses.name: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: A scholarly project at the 300 level proposed by the individual student in conversation with a member of faculty who is willing to act as supervisor. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: CGPA 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; 10 FCE; Specialist or Major in Drama; A written proposal; Independent study form signed by both student and faculty instructor to be submitted for approval to the Associate Director (undergraduate) before registration: August 1st for September start date; November 1st for January start date.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
A written proposal; Independent study form to be submitted for approval to the Associate Director (undergraduate) by August 1st for a September start date. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

courses.name: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: A scholarly project at the 300 level proposed by the individual student in conversation with a member of faculty who is willing to act as supervisor. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.

A written proposal; Independent study form to be submitted for approval to the Associate Director (undergraduate) by August 1st for a September start date. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: An in-depth study of devising theatre in a group context. This course offers an intensive exploration of the history and practice of devised theatre within the late 20th and early 21st centuries that will culminate in a number of in-class and public performances. This course is open to acting, directing, playwriting, and production and design students. The Application Deadline is April 10th.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Performance: Devised Theatre
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Specialist or Major in Drama with a minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM300Y1 or DRM354Y1 or DRM328H1 or DRM302H1; a letter of interest and permission of the Drama Centre.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Apply online in March: https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login There will be additional tutorial times which will be held regularly. Dates and times to be determined based on student availability. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: Advanced voice training to refine the skills and concepts developed thus far in DRM200Y1 and DRM300Y1, focusing on performance. Techniques of articulation, speech, and rhetoric are studied. Taken in conjunction with DRM403Y1: Advanced Performance: Mainstage and DRM411H1: Advanced Concepts in Movement.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Concepts in Voice
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM300Y1; Acceptance into DRM403Y1 or permission from the instructor.
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: Minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM300Y1; Acceptance into DRM403Y1 or permission from the instructor.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: An exploration of advanced directing for the theatre. The class is centered on student directed productions, which are publically presented at the end of term. Emphasis is placed on the development of strong central concepts and realizing the production with imagination, collaboration and creativity. Priority is reserved for Drama Majors and Specialists. The Application Deadline is April 10th.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Directing
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Specialist or Major in Drama with a minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM302H1; DRM331H1; a written proposal and an interview in April.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Apply online in April: https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login There will be additional tutorial times which will be held regularly. Dates and times to be determined based on student availability. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: This course, taught each year by a different visiting professional theatre director, offers upper-level theatre and performance studies students the opportunity to explore acting in a full-length production. Plays are selected to challenge students in a variety of diverse ways, exposing them to a full spectrum of theatre and performance genres and possibilities. The Application Deadline is April 10th.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Performance:Mainstage
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Specialist or Major in Drama with a minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM300Y1,1 FCE from DRM301H1/DRM311H1/DRM375H1/DRM376H1/ DRM377H1/DRM378H1; An audition in April.
cmCourseInfo.corequisitesText: DRM401H1, DRM411H1 (or permission of the Centre).

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Apply online in March: https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: Advanced movement training to refine the skills and concepts developed thus far in DRM200Y1 and DRM300Y1, focusing on performance. Techniques of personal physical awareness, movement as a tool for discovery in acting processes, movement as communication in performance, ensemble work, and movement generation are studied. Taken in conjunction with DRM403Y1: Advanced Performance: Mainstage and DRM401H1: Advanced Concepts in Voice.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Concepts in Movement
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM300Y1; Acceptance into DRM403Y1 or permission from the instructor.
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: Minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM300Y1; Acceptance into DRM403Y1 or permission from the instructor.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: A continuation of DRM328H1, concentrating upon the in-depth knowledge and practice of playwriting with an emphasis on advanced style and technique of writing for the stage. Students develop their own longer work through in-class exercises, one major written assignment, and the final public presentation. See Portfolio Guidelines for information on how to apply.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Playwriting
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1, DRM328H1 and a portfolio of writing samples due in November.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Selection is based on an portfolio submission. Apply online by November 10th. https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login There will be additional tutorial times which will be held regularly. Dates and times to be determined based on student availability. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

cmCourseInfo.description: Continues the exploration of design and production techniques. Students are given an opportunity to use their knowledge and skills from previous production courses on an advanced level. Students are expected to participate in Drama Centre productions in senior creative and leadership roles. Focus also includes the integration of digital technology into theatrical performance. The Application Deadline is March 10th for an interview in April. See department website for application details.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advanced Production and Design
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; DRM254Y1 and DRM354Y1; and permission of the Drama Centre

courses.name: Senior Seminar: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies Thesis

cmCourseInfo.description: Research thesis, emphasizing topics and methods used in drama, theatre and performance studies. Students must obtain permission from the instructor by submitting a research project proposal. The project may engage creative practice, but the thesis itself will be a critical, written work engaging the research and dramaturgy involved in the performance or artwork. Not eligible for CR/NCR option. See online application for details.
cmCourseInfo.title: Senior Seminar: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies Thesis
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Minimum CGPA of 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; 14 FCE, Specialist or Major in Drama and a research project proposal.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Apply online in April: https://drama-apply.chass.utoronto.ca/login. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.

courses.name: Senior Seminar in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: An in-depth examination of selected issues in the theatre at the 400 level. Content may vary depending on instructor and therefore may be counted towards Groups A or B. Please consult the Undergraduate Drama office or check the programs website for more details.
cmCourseInfo.title: Senior Seminar in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; 14 FCE, Specialist or Major in Drama and/or permission of the instructor.

courses.name: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: A scholarly project at the 400 level proposed by the individual student in conversation with a member of faculty who is willing to act as supervisor. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: CGPA 2.7; DRM220Y1/DRM230Y1; 14 FCE; Specialist or Major in Drama; A written proposal; Independent study form signed by both student and faculty instructor to be submitted for approval to the Associate Director (undergraduate) before registration: August 1st for September start date; November 1st for January start date.

Timetable Instructions
A written proposal, signed by both student and faculty instructor, must be submitted for approval to the Program before registration by August 1st for a September start date. For more information, please contact Colleen Osborn at c.osborn@utoronto.ca.
